This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

untested, but something like this should work:
```suggestion
  simpa only [mul_neg, neg_pos, neg_neg_iff_pos] using ofReal_mul_pos_iff x (-z)
```
Hum, that doesn't seem to work because the corresponding `CovariantClass ℂ ℂ` instance is missing for `neg_pos`. In fact, I don't think it holds in this case.

@xroblot no, this definitely works, it's just that Mathlib doesn't know `ℂ` is `StrictOrderedCommRing` until `Analysis.Complex.Basic` because it gets the `RCLike.toStrictOrderedCommRing` instance. You can see this in the playground:
```
import Mathlib.Data.Complex.Order
import Mathlib.Analysis.Complex.Basic

open ComplexOrder Complex

theorem nonpos_iff {z : ℂ} : z ≤ 0 ↔ z.re ≤ 0 ∧ z.im = 0 :=
  le_def

theorem neg_iff {z : ℂ} : z < 0 ↔ z.re < 0 ∧ z.im = 0 :=
  lt_def

theorem ofReal_mul_pos_iff (x : ℝ) (z : ℂ) :
    0 < x * z ↔ (x < 0 ∧ z < 0) ∨ (0 < x ∧ 0 < z) := by
  simp_rw [pos_iff, neg_iff, re_ofReal_mul, im_ofReal_mul]
  obtain hx | hx | hx := lt_trichotomy x 0
  · simp_rw [mul_pos_iff, eq_comm, mul_eq_zero, hx, not_lt_of_gt hx, hx.ne, false_and, true_and,
      false_or, or_false]
  · simp_rw [hx, zero_mul, lt_self_iff_false, false_and, false_or]
  · simp_rw [mul_pos_iff, eq_comm, mul_eq_zero, hx, not_lt_of_gt hx, hx.ne', false_and, true_and,
      false_or, or_false]

theorem ofReal_mul_neg_iff (x : ℝ) (z : ℂ) :
    x * z < 0 ↔ (x < 0 ∧ 0 < z) ∨ (0 < x ∧ z < 0) := by
  simpa only [mul_neg, neg_pos, neg_neg_iff_pos] using ofReal_mul_pos_iff x (-z)
```
Obviously we can't import that here.

I think probably what you want is to either copy the proofs of `RCLike.toStrictOrderedCommRing` and `RCLike.toStarOrderedRing` into this file, or else prove these lemmas for `RCLike` and move them to the later file.

I would suggest the latter, unless for some reason you really only want these lemmas for `ℂ` and you really want to avoid importing analysis into wherever you use them.

Sorry, I completely missed that point. 

Anyway, thanks for the explanation. I moved the results to `RCLike.Basic`.
does `simp only` work here? also, indenting is slightly nonstandard

Yeah, sorry about the indenting. I'll fix that. 

`simp only` does work indeed. Do you think it's better than using `simp_rw`?

`simp_rw [a, b, c]` is implemented internally as `simp only; simp only [a]; simp only [b]; simp only [c]`. So `simp only` is in some sense more fundamental. It's also used at least 3x more often in the library. So personally I tend to use `simp_rw` only when neither `simp only` nor `rw` would work; but it's clearly just a matter of taste.

I didn't know that. Thanks for the input. I was mostly using `simp_rw` because I like to see terms changing step by step. I find it quite rewarding :) 

BTW, David, if you have a little time can I interest you in having a look at #18166. I need the result way but I am not sure the way I prove it is the right one.
Already on the case :-)

Slightly quicker alternative:
```suggestion
  simp only [pos_iff (K := K), neg_iff (K := K), re_ofReal_mul, im_ofReal_mul]
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Complex/Order): add some results about multiplication of a real and a complex
